This report shows two possible clustering analyses: hierarchical and k-means.

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
#install.packages("rio")
library(rio)

data <- import("./data/heart.csv")
head(data)
names(data)

```

##Hierarchical clustering
```{r}

X <- as.matrix(data)

hc<-hclust(dist(X), "average")
#other options: complete or average
plot(hc)
plot(hc, hang=-1, main="Patient characteristics", ylab=NULL)


```

##K-means clustering
```{r}

set.seed(100)
km<-kmeans(X, 5)
i<-6; j<-8
plot(X[,i], X[,j], xlab=colnames(X)[i], ylab=colnames(X)[j], type="n")
for(s in 1:nrow(X)) {
text(X[s,i], X[s,j], rownames(X)[s], col=km$cluster[s])
}

```
